str2: Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
